abstract: Kosovo Parliament rejects constitutional amendments that would have paved way for special war crimes court to prosecute acts like killings of hundreds of Serbian civilians during war for independence in late 1990s.
lead_paragraph: Kosovo’s Parliament voted Friday not to approve constitutional amendments that would have allowed the establishment of a special court to prosecute war crimes.

headline.main: Kosovo: Parliament Votes Against Court to Prosecute Crimes in ’90s War
headline.print_headline: Europe; Kosovo: Parliament Votes Against Court to Prosecute Crimes in ’90s War

snippet: Kosovo’s Parliament voted Friday not to approve constitutional amendments that would have allowed the establishment of a special court to prosecute war crimes.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
